content.title: Error in thomas-iniguez-visioli/youtube-public: Update is not a fast forward - https://docs.github...
content.body:
### Error Details
- **Repository:** thomas-iniguez-visioli/youtube-public
- **Event:** issues
- **Action:** labeled
- **Error Message:** Update is not a fast forward - https://docs.github.com/rest/git/refs#update-a-reference

### Stack Trace

    at async GitHubClient.updateRef (file:///home/runner/work/youtube-public/youtube-public/.kanban-action/src/github/api-client.js:71:7)
    at async GitHubClient.commitFile (file:///home/runner/work/youtube-public/youtube-public/.kanban-action/src/github/api-client.js:149:7)
    at async WorkflowManager.processGitHubIssue (file:///home/runner/work/youtube-public/youtube-public/.kanban-action/src/workflow/manager.js:159:9)
    at async run (file:///home/runner/work/youtube-public/youtube-public/.kanban-action/action.js:44:7)

content.author: alphaleadership

acceptanceCriteria: The GitHub Action should successfully update Git references (e.g., commit files) without failing due to 'Update is not a fast forward' errors when the target branch has been updated concurrently.
A robust retry mechanism, including fetching the latest branch state and re-applying changes, should be implemented for Git reference update operations to handle transient conflicts.
The `.kanban-action` workflow should complete successfully without errors when an issue is labeled, ensuring that any associated file updates (e.g., Kanban board state) are persisted.

fileActions.explanation: To understand the current implementation of `updateRef` and `commitFile` and identify where retry logic or a more robust Git update strategy can be applied.
To understand how `processGitHubIssue` calls `GitHubClient.commitFile` and the context in which file changes are generated for 'labeled' events.
To understand the main entry point and overall flow of the GitHub Action, which might influence where to implement retry logic.
